title: News: A$AP Rocky talks Homophopia in Hip-Hop
body:
You might remember back to the rise of **[Tyler the Creator](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/7544-opinion-2-jc-tyler-the-creator-%e2%80%93-goblin/ "Opinion #2 (JC): Tyler, The Creator – Goblin")** and the piece I wrote concerning **[homophobia within music](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/life/5212-homophobia-in-music/ "Feature: Homophobia In Music")**. Looking back, the piece with thin in its references and lacked a cutting blow to our friend Tyler. Yet my point still stands, as a group of music lovers, I don’t think we challenged Tyler about his abusive and bigoted vocabulary enough.

A year goes by and we have a new Prince of Hip-Hop, **[A$AP Rocky](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/13848-new-aap-rocky-celebration/ "New: A$AP Rocky – Celebration")**, and it seems a remarkable change in doctrine to go with it. Below is a transcription of an interview he did with [**Spinner**](http://www.spinner.com/2012/02/17/asap-rocky-hip-hop-homophobia/) and his attitude to homophobia within hip-hop.

It’s an exciting attitude to hear from the new generation of Hip-Hop, but with cats like **Tyler the Creator** still as popular as ever, is it enough?

“I don’t give a f— about your business. Man, if you’re gay we can be friends. If you’re straight, we can be friends…I really don’t give a fuck and I don’t think anyone should care about what another man’s preference is…As long as you’re a great person and, y’know, you don’t bother me and make me uncomfortable, then let’s be friends, dude.

\[Hip-hop\] needs to stop being so close-minded because that will just cause the genre to fail. Look at pop. Pop doesn’t discriminate against people. Look at Lady Gaga, y’know what I mean? Who the fuck makes the rules for hip-hop? Who the fuck dictates who’s cool and who’s not?”
